Package helpers

Class Helpers

java.lang.Object
helpers.Helpers
public class Helpers
extends java.lang.Object
The Helpers class consists of functions that are useful for all three application. These includes reading the network property pathway, to communication through TCP/IP protocols.

    • readProps

      public static java.util.Properties readProps​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.IOException
      Reads the properties from the specified file (.props)
      Parameters:
      filePath - The string file path to be read from
      Returns:
      Properties object that can have values retrieved from it
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - If the file cannot be found

    • validatePort

      public static int validatePort​(java.lang.String port) throws BadPortNumberException
      Parses a String port number to an integer and ensures that it is within the acceptable range of 0 to 65535.
      Parameters:
      port - The string port number to be parsed and validated
      Returns:
      Integer representation of the port number
      Throws:
      BadPortNumberException - - For port numbers less than 0 or greater than 65535

      Returns:

    • initClient

      public static java.lang.Object initClient​(java.lang.Object message) throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      initClient initialises a client to send a message to the server via a Socket with a port number and IP from the network.props file. Communication is handled through input/output streams. //TODO: Methods can be requested if the message sent follows the pattern... General usage notes: always flush streams at the correct time + interleave the operations so that they are in the same order. Write, read on client = Read, write on server (flush in between). Ensure that every object sent across implements "Serializable" to convert to bytes.
      Parameters:
      message - String message to be send to the server (indicates method)
      Returns:
      Server's response (either acknowledgement or data object from database connection)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Thrown if unknown server host when communicating through sockets
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the object received from the server is instantiated from a class that is not found

    • bytesToString

      public static java.lang.String bytesToString​(byte[] hash)
      Converts inputted bytes to a string (required for password validation)
      Parameters:
      hash - an array of bytes to be converted to a string type
      Returns:
      String representation of the provided bytes Reference - From CAB302 Week 9 Assignment Lecture
